abstract.text: This is the control object for the visual representation of the MapsIndoors SDK.

Hide or show the floor selector, defaults to false.

Protocol specifying how an indoor positioning provider should be implemented if the users location is to be exposed to
Move the camera to the entity.
Select a Building.

This allows for an easy way to display a route on the MapsIndoors map. Each leg of the route can be shown individually and can be navigated by manipulating the selected leg index. Various customization options are available to adjust the polyline styling and camera behavior.
Clear any previously applied filter.
Select a floor index.
Convenience: Disable LiveData for a given domain (includes default live data badged icons).
Convenience: Enable LiveData for a given domain (includes default live data badged icons).
This is the control object for the visual representation of the MapsIndoors SDK.
Get the currently selected Building.
Apply a filter to the map. Only show the
s included in the list.
Select a Location.
Set a custom label font, text size, color and halo.
Get the currently selected Location.
Get or set the cluster icon generator (if none is set, the default internal will be used).

The route model contains the route components: The start and end point, the overall route distance, the duration using the given travel mode(s), the actual route components (legs and steps) containing the route geometry and actions (shifts, turns, climbs etc.) performed to get to the destination point. Typically this object is not manually instantiated, but returns as a result from the

on the map.
Get or set the floor selector (if none is set, a default floor selector will be used).
Get the currently selected Venue.
Listen to events.
MapsIndoors iOS SDK v4 can use either Google Maps or Mapbox Maps to show and interact with your indoors maps in an iOS app.
Hide or show the info window on user-selected locations (default is true)
Get the current camera position state.
This holds the data for a single location and a marker to display the data on a map.
Get the current floor index.
